(In reply to comment #3)

I am having the same problem, so I'll step in with a few more details...

> 1.reproducable steps.

Either:

- Switch to the Property Editor view
- Click *any* item on a report that can be styled
  while the Property Editor view is active.

> 2.environment information like eclipse/GEF/emf/OS infromation to help us?

I'm running:

- Mac OS X 10.3.9
- Eclipse 3.0.2 (Build id: 200503110845)
- GEF 3.0.1
- emf 2.0.3 (although some emf components appear to go back to 2.0.0)

Created an attachment (id=24574)
Stack trace for Property Editor view activation

(Update to comment #4)

Actually, switching to the Property Editor generates slightly different errors.

First, the dialog that pops up reads "An error has occurred when activating this
view" as opposed to "An error has occurred. See error log for more details."

Second, the stack trace for the error is slightly different. I'va attached a
text file containing the stack trace generated by attempting to activate the
Property Editor view.

Third, the activation error is followed by two other errors in the log:

- An "Unhandled event loop exception", for which "An exception stack trace could
not be found"

- "Widget is disposed", containing the stack trace initially posted by Dave Cramer.

Hi Dave: Which Birt release did you use when the error happened as you described?
Now, I recommond you take the latest Birt release(2.1.0, currently) to have a try and see if the error still exist.
Thanks and looking forwar to your response.

Hongchang,

I haven't been using BIRT for almost a year, so I don't have any further info for you.

Dave
Changed the resolution as WONTFIX, as Birt 1.0.0 did not support for Mac OS X, and the latest Birt release doesn't have this bug when running in Mac OS X.
